website_summaries.verdict: Not a traditional Japanese bento box design, but uses the same philosophy. Perhaps not as durable as other contenders, but great for school lunches and diets.
pros: Color-coded lids for easy user identification
Inexpensive to replace, so can be disposable
Lids fit very securely, keep foods separated
cons: Inferior counterfeits reportedly sold on occasion

customer_reviews.title: Best lunchboxes for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: I love the easy lunch boxes! I originally bought them for my kids for daycare and for future school lunches and ended up using them for mine and my husbands lunches as well! We used them so much we bought 2 more sets so now we have a total of 4 and all of the colors. They work GREAT!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Canady

customer_reviews.title: Great containers for a child's lunch box
customer_reviews.text: This 3-pack of 3 compartment plastic, bento lunch box containers fits perfectly in my daughter's insulated, fabric lunch box. (see photos) After sitting the closed container in the lunchbox, I slip a thin igloo freeze pack in the pocket opposite the container and everything stays cold and fresh. The plastic is fairly thick and the top seals well to keep foods separated during the trip to school in my daughter's backpack. I've used the same container for the last 3 weeks without issue. (In an attempt to make it last longer, I hand wash the lunch box after each school day.) I would highly recommend these containers.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone down.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second set of these after using the first set for almost two years. Unfortunately the second set seems to be of much lower quality. I use these to pack my kids school lunches. We're barely a month in and one container has already become unusable. The rest seem like they aren't far behind.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jane

customer_reviews.title: Wish it would've worked!
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about these lunch boxes for my kid. But I have only had these for 1 day and I had following issues - 1. The first time I washed them, the lids cracked. I haven't used them, just light washing before using it and the lid cracked! 2. These are too big will not fit in your standard kids lunch bag.
customer_reviews.author: VB

customer_reviews.title: Lids and bottoms crack/break easily
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these lunchboxes 3 times from the same manufacturer. The set I received most recently (ordered in Sept 2018) has not been of the same quality. After a few months of use, all of the lid "lips" have cracked making it hard for my kids to open and with sharp edges. I take good care of these, never put in dishwasher and still this has happened. The previous sets I purchased in 2014 and 2016 did not have this problem. I'm so disappointed. Amazon has many to choose from and I wanted the quality I had received previously.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits kids lunchboxes perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: These work great! Plenty of room for lunches, so far they are leak proof, and easy to wash. I throw them in the top rack of my dish washer and I've not had any issues with warping. My 7 year old can open them without assistance at school. They fit enough food for my teens. The best part is they fit in all our school lunch boxes. We have several different brands of the typical square zippered lunchboxes and have not had any issues with size. There's even still room for granola bar and juice box. I purchased 2 sets and have had 0 issues with any of them.
customer_reviews.author: KT Midwestern

customer_reviews.title: Quality of product decreased. These new ones break easily.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these 3.5 years ago and loved them. They are still in one piece and used daily. I have more kids in school, so I purchased more. They are a slightly different size, so lids don’t match with the old ones. The ones I ordered this February are breaking. The bento portions are cracked and falling apart. Quality of product decreased a lot in 3 years. I want more to replace them, but feel like they were a waste of money. I will have to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Makayla

customer_reviews.title: Check Dimensions
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kiddos’ lunch boxes to avoid using plastic baggies everyday. The size of these containers are good although a standard sandwich barely fits into the large compartment and the whole box doesn’t fit into my kids’ lunch boxes. I have to stretch out the zipper and can’t put anything else in their lunch box. They have the regular pottery barn lunchboxes. It also doesn’t fit into another lunchbox from a big box store. The description says these aren’t designed to be leakproof and frankly, the top is hard to close snugly all the way around. These are decent containers and I’ll keep using them just cuz I spent the money to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: R K Chand

customer_reviews.title: Danger! Amazon you need to lose this product like 4 years ago! Could have killed my kid!
customer_reviews.text: I just opened these 20 min ago, hand washed the first one in soap and water, hand dried it, and put my 3.5 year olds lunch inside —only to see it’s broken! I actually thought it was a feature to help little fingers open the lid. Glad I caught it before I sent her to school to choke on a shard of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Emily C

customer_reviews.title: Product Dimensions Changed
customer_reviews.text: I have happily used this product for seven years. Over time and daily use, they start to crack and chip. I don't mind because they are excellent value for the money, and I've replaced two sets over the years. This week I purchased new sets. THEY ARE NOT COMPATIBLE WITH MY OLDER ONES. The dimensions are slightly different that the lids do not align and will not close. Now I have two stacks to keep separate or I'll spent precious morning minutes sorting for a lid that fits. I used to recommend these to all my friends and I still will, but with a warning. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: After three months, the plastic is breaking
customer_reviews.text: After using these for about 3 months (regular use for kids lunches), the plastic on the lids and the containers is cracking and breaking. I wash them on the top rack of the dishwasher like the instructions direct. I really liked the portion sizes and the fact that four came in a set. Just really disappointed that they are such poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong and it’s been 3 years!
customer_reviews.text: I mean come on, for the price and the fact that they’ve been used pretty much every day by a toddler now kid, and still going strong, is amazing. Are they perfect and indestructible? No...but not much is honestly. These have great sized compartments, fit in our lunch bag perfectly, and have stood up pretty well. Yes a couple tabs have broken off. Otherwise In really good shape...I do only hand wash these as with all plastic. A little hard to clean in the ridges of the lid. All in all they have been great and we still use them all the time. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ela G.

customer_reviews.title: 2 1/2 years later, still love them
customer_reviews.text: I did buy a second set because 1 lid broke and daughter prefers certain colors. Other than that, I love. Use with 2 kids for daycare, 4 days each a week. I’m getting the 4 divided boxes today so I can send with the individual yogurt containers in their lunch box. This set isn’t deep enough to hold yogurt which is fine. I could just empty in here but I’m lazy. Probably should do that instead of writing this review but hopefully I save another mom time, and prevent them from buying another, different container that is junk. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cooking Leaf

customer_reviews.title: Wrong colors delivered
customer_reviews.text: First my gripe: I ordered the "brights" color but received the classic. The colors are fine and my pink/purple loving daughter will deal with the red/blue/orange/green... But the brights are more expensive than the classic colors and it's a hassle to have to return etc to try to get the correct color. I'm disappointed that I ended up spending more money and receiving the cheaper color option instead. Feel a bit cheated. The boxes are much sturdier than I was expecting which is nice though. After getting them, I decided to also get the mini dippers that fit inside. Because I think they'll probably keep things separated but not liquids/dips.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love these containers! I purchased them for son going to school for the first time to put different little nibbles of food that he'd like and they were a hit with him! Lids are just a bit hard to fully click on, but once they are on nothing spills! I was actually afraid to place yogurt on one of small sides but it didn't spill! So for that I give it 5 stars. Sadly my son forgets and tosses the container in the trash ( as sees the other kids do) and I've lost 2 so far which means time to reorder! And FYI they do fit your standard lunch box!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Good lunchbox for Kindergartener
customer_reviews.text: As other have mentioned, the lid doesn't snap on as easily as I hoped. I have to make sure I snap it on tightly on all sides; I doubt my 5 year old can. However, until I find something better, 4 for the given price is fine as I can clean the containers quickly and easily. I prefer these lunchboxes over the popular Bentgo or Yumbox as I've read so many reviews of mold forming on the rubber molds on the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C.

customer_reviews.title: Almost great!
customer_reviews.text: These lunch boxes have endured two years of elementary school lunches, and they continue to be our go-to box. Just the right size. Easy to clean. Fits perfectly in the PackIt lunch bag. My only complaint is that they do leak, so we cannot pack anything with any type of juice - not even cut strawberries.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieO

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: These worked great to keep sandwich fixings and salad fixings in the cooler on a 2-day car trip to Louisiana and back to Wisconsin. Especially during Covid-19 so we could avoid going into restaurants and reduce the amount of people we were exposed to. Also didn't have to worry about what we were eating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price and they work
customer_reviews.text: These have worked great so far, only been using them for 2 weeks. The size is perfect for lunch kit and the containers work great to separate. They are not leakproof with peaches. The fruit cups wouldn't fit in the slot so I drained the juice and poured them in. By lunchtime it was a mess in lunch kit.
customer_reviews.author: Str8kuntry

customer_reviews.title: Durable Containers with Lids that Stay On - Buying our 2nd Set!
customer_reviews.text: Have had a set of 4 for 2+ years and they're awesome! Perfect for daycare lunch for our little guy. We've used them 4 days a week since he was 18 mths and now he's 4. These are roomy enough for an adult lunch but give a good visual clue on when you're overpacking for smaller bellies. Read reviews from other versions of this bento box that said the lids don't stay on tight. The lids on this brand, easylunchboxes, stay on great. The plastic on this brand is thick and durable and stands up well against a toddler. Writing this review as I'm purchasing my second set :)
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, keeps food fresh and portion size areas are great!  Must have Lunch Box Accessory
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and portion areas. Got this for my lady and she LOVES it... perfect size for lunch, breaks and snacks on her 12 hour days at work. Bringing the EasyLunchboxes 3-Compartment Bento Lunch Box Containers to work is simple they fit perfectly in the lunch bag, easy to stack and clean. Keeps food fresh from Carrots to the Ranch Dressing everything fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Nast

customer_reviews.title: Lid cracked after one month - approximately 6 uses - 4 days after the return window closed
customer_reviews.text: The lid broke with normal once or twice a week use in my lunch bag a month after we received it - 4 days AFTER the return window closed. It wasn’t handled roughly. I’ve had a set for 3 years and the lids have never cracked, so I wonder if they changed the way they make it or if I got a bad batch. Amazon or the company should offer a refund or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: TRAM

customer_reviews.title: Bought years ago loved it- bought another set but they Arrived with cracked lids
customer_reviews.text: Did you guys change these? I bought these a few years ago and We love them and I bought another set. When they arrived two of the little tabs on the lids were cracked off. The plastic on the lids seems thinner, stiffer and less flexible than the ones I bought years ago. No wonder they were cracked. I returned them. What a shame.
customer_reviews.author: JAM2000

customer_reviews.title: Cracked Within Months of Purchase-Not Like They Used To Be
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these lunch containers has gone downhill significantly. Had used the same set from 2016 and never had any issues. Ordered again because we liked them so much and the two new sets we got strated cracking and falling within a few months of use. Feeling frustrated and will find something different next time.
customer_reviews.author: teach 2

customer_reviews.title: Cracked after one wash
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kids lunches and am pretty bummed. I washed them, top rack, in my dishwasher ONE TIME & one cracked when I took it out. Now I’ll have an uneven number for 2 kids, which I hate or will have mismatch lunch containers because I don’t want to buy more of them. Very frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy F

customer_reviews.title: Munch, Munch...
customer_reviews.text: It's time for lunch! These are excellent lunchbox companions! They seal well, wash up nicely and have bright, happy colors. My kids love these and use them daily for school! This is the second set I have purchased. The first set I bought over five and a half years ago and they are just now starting to show signs of wear and tear (hence the second set). For a plastic lunch set, I think that is pretty great!
customer_reviews.author: TwinMom

customer_reviews.title: Looking for new lunchbox - realized these have lasted 3 years so far
customer_reviews.text: With COVID-19, we have to pack more food for the kids, so we're looking for a larger lunch bag. I searched my orders to see what the dimensions are for these containers - purchased 10/08/2017. We use them every weekday daily for the kids' lunches. That's 2-3 times per week per individual box - that's a lot of use! We are still using them and see no sign of breakage or other significant wear. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in my lunch cooler. If you have a set size cooler that you prefer to use, consider measuring before purchase. Have not used with liquids to check for leaks or staining that comes from heating liquids in the microwave. Truthfully, not sure if this is leak proof (in product description), but was not needed for my use. The top can be a bit difficult to snap closed. May be a bit challenging for someone with dexterity issues.
customer_reviews.author: JDH

customer_reviews.title: Good, but corners are breaking
customer_reviews.text: I have seen so many reviews for these products both through here & through vloggers on youtube swearing by it. I used to use ziploc containers & actually tossed the ones I had used for 2 years when I bought these. I was really hoping these would be great. I knew they were not leak proof - a bit of a bummer for me. But I didn't expect them to be so fragile. I have a six & seven year old. I would not say they are especially rough with their lunch box, but 3 or the 4 have a damaged corner lip, those three the corner lip has broken off. Disappointing for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy S

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite go-to lunch boxes for everyday for my kids. The portion size is great for my preschooler to have lots of options and big enough for my 5th graders. I even use these lunch boxes to pack cold lunches for my husband for work.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Saves on using plastic bags!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kids' lunch bags. They're portioned just right for them and fit well into their lunch bags. I love that I don't have to package their lunches in plastic baggies and that these are easy to clean. They are not leakproof, which I was aware of before purchasing, but that isn't a deal breaker for me. They're holding up well after repeated use. Worth the money in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hromek

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love the color choices! These are perfect for beach/ pool or ANYWHERE day trips. Each of my kids get a different color so they instantly know whose is whose. No more smushed sandwiches or grape casualties from rough loading/unloading. They use Yumbox Bentos for school on a regular basis, but I don't like having to clean the sand off them when I've taken them to the beach in the past. These are a perfect middle ground to avoid the usage of mass Ziplocks.
customer_reviews.author: Holli

customer_reviews.title: If you enjoy being stabbed with jagged plastic, this is the container for you!
customer_reviews.text: Two of the lids came cracked right out of the box. There were jagged pieces that had broken off sticking out like spikes.
customer_reviews.author: Rosilyne

customer_reviews.title: Colorful, fun, and already held up for a YEAR of grade school!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these lunch compartments for my child. I also love the colors what I change out everyday to give variety; they are fun. They are fit the right amount of food for a grade school child. I have not put any liquid foods in the containers, If I do they are in a separate container to avoid leaks. They fit perfect in the Wildkin lunch bags perfectly! I also use the Easy Lunchboxes dippers for items such as nuts, applesauce, ranch, peanut butter etc. and they fit perfectly with these containers. No cracks so far, used them for one year and will be using them for another year of grade school!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Buy these containers!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for packing my daughter's lunch. The compartments are well sized (the square one fits an applesauce cup perfectly), the lids fit securely and it fits well in her padded lunchbox so I can include an ice pack to keep things chilled until lunchtime. We have used these every weekday and thrown them in the dishwasher for over a year and they have held up well. Will be ordering a new set for this school year.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: hassle and energy and I want to meet the lady who invented these and be her best friend.
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I survived the past 2 years of my kids starting school without these. I want to contact Micheal J Fox and see if I can get back into the time machine and make a re-do of the horror and nightmares of separate containers, baggies, and headaches. These little gems of a product save me time, hassle and energy and I want to meet the lady who invented these and be her best friend...LOL. Seriously, packing lunches is now fun, I have plenty of room for everything in the the cute seven dollar lunch box...and my kids are over the moon to have a smorgashbord of fun little tastes with their sandwiches. Have fun easylunchboxing!
customer_reviews.author: Mt. View Parents

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lunch box containers to use in my daughter's lunch box in lieu of single-use plastic bags. They are great! They not only allow for good portion control, but they wash easy, they hold up to a 5-year old , and they come in fun colors as well. I did also purchase the little dressing containers, but have not used them. Honestly would have liked something a little smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Megan C

customer_reviews.title: Great for portions but covers are not durable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kids lunches (they love to take salads) and I thought the 2 extra spaces would be great for fruit or treat, however these do not work well with any type of liquid/wetness. I put in some mandarin oranges and grapes that I washed (so very minimal wetness) and it ended up seeping into the other compartments. It's a great size, but I'm going to look for something else with a stronger or more leak proof cover.
customer_reviews.author: MommyOf3

customer_reviews.title: Great for lunches
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfectly inside our toddler's Skip Hop lunch box. They're a little trickier to wash just because the dishwasher likes to turn them over if they're not placed "just so" or against something that will keep them down during the wash cycles. Otherwise, they're pretty great. We have had one lid break and if you're not diligent in making sure all sides are down (listen for the click), you may have some spillage between compartments.
customer_reviews.author: S. Story

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, not leak proof, cannot return
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed with this item and I’m stuck with it because I’m not allowed to return it. It’s not leak proof, which defeats the purpose of having a good set of lunch box items if I have fear of them leaking. This is going to wind up in the goodwill pile because I don’t want to use this poor quality item
customer_reviews.author: Ammie

customer_reviews.title: new product is not the same good quality anymore
customer_reviews.text: I used the same set daily for years on end without any issues. This last set I ordered lasted 3 weeks....if that. They have all cracked and the lids have ALL broken and are sharp and dangerous. I am so disappointed. I relied on these for years and now have to find a new option.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great for packing lunches
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I use these everyday to pack my child’s lunch for school. I can pack a sandwich - most of the time only half - but that’s only because she can’t eat a full one in the time allotted. I can fit a Danimal yogurt drink in the large spot with the half sandwich or use a silicone muffin mould for carrot sticks or other snacks. I use the smaller sections for cookies, fruit, veggies or chips. Very versatile. I hand wash them but you can dishwash as well. Easy for my child to open and less waste rather than using ziploc bags for everything. The container fits perfectly in her lunch bag.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine L

customer_reviews.title: They look like they are good quality
customer_reviews.text: They look like they are good quality, and hold up great until.... the lids crack. The lids don't stay on tight at all, especially after you use them more. Then when they snap, they are useless. I wouldn't recommend storing it on its side, or putting it in a backpack or anything that will put pressure on it, I think they would eventually crack. This is probably best when you want to carry it carefully from your house, to your car, to your office, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: LMichele

customer_reviews.title: so I wouldn't put anything liquid like applesauce. Also
customer_reviews.text: Neatly organizes my daughter's lunch and she has everything open and available to her immediately. She's in kindergarten and she has a bit of trouble opening containers. With these, she just has to open one. They are not leak proof. She mashed up her pear slices and it leaked out and made a huge mess in her lunch box, so I wouldn't put anything liquid like applesauce. Also, the very first day we used one, the tab broke off. All of the others seem to still be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Moon Pie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic plastic!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for my daughter's lunch for over 3 years and love them! They've held up nicely and fit inside most lunchboxes. I just bought more now that my son has started school. The colors are fun and neutral.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Lid tabs break
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a set years ago and they have really lasted. My son has cerebral palsy and these containers have been great for him to open by himself at school. I bought this 2nd set because I’ve started using them for my daughter. I’m disappointed to find that the lids are more brittle- my son has broken the tab off 2 of them already. He can’t use them without that entry point. Additionally, where the tab broke is very sharp and jagged. Not sure what changed. I would have given 5 stars if they were exactly the same as the original set I purchased. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Henard

customer_reviews.title: Cover doesn't click. Decent for price.
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to get these and just wash 1 container instead of 5 small ones for our 4k and 2nd grade kids. I knew they weren't leak proof when buying them so I use Glad press n seal when packing runny stuff. Overall they're good for the price. I bought 2 packs (8 total) & two months later, 1 has broke. Keep in mind I also put them in the dishwasher. Disappointed they don't click or snap when the cover is on tight. I probably won't buy this brand again, but maybe something similar. UPDATE: 1 week later, there's now 3 broken. Going back to washing a million little containers for their lunches. At least Tupperware holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is the second year of buying these. I bought them last year for my kids' lunch boxes and they used them every day for a full school year. They held up well (just the tabs used to pull of the lids broke on a few), so I bought another pack for this year, because at this price, they are so worth it. It makes it easy to manage good portions for my kids, keeps their food from touching (which is a big deal for kids) and kept the inside of their nice lunch bags clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for my kindergartner's lunch
customer_reviews.text: ***updated*** Kindergarten is now over and these containers survived the first year of school splendidly. I have washed them many times in the dishwasher and the lids still stay on snuggly. Keep in mind that these are meant for little hands to open without assistance so they are not supposed to fit air tight. I have never had any issues with leaking or spilling but I also do not put "wet" foods in these. These are perfect for my kindergartner's lunch. The lids are loose but that's what I liked about them. He's able to get them on and off without any assistance. I've never had any issues with his food spilling or dumping out.
customer_reviews.author: momto2boys

customer_reviews.title: Pefect for school lunches
customer_reviews.text: I love these lunchboxes and have been using them for over six years. They last a long time. I've only gone through three sets in all of that time. They stand up to a lot of abuse in the course of the day and wash up great in the dishwasher at night. We use them for school lunches, as they fit great into the lunchboxes, and we also use them for dinners on the go at the baseball or soccer fields.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: They break and crack within a year. Disposable junk.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up replacing these with metal lunch boxes for the whole family for our lunches. First, these start having edges break off and leave jagged edges. Then they crack and generally end up looking horrible within a year even without microwaving them or putting anything like tomatoes in them. I guess if you're prepared to keep buying more plastic and dumping it in a landfill year after year they are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha K. Webb

customer_reviews.title: NOT good for dips!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these boxes in 2 different color sets for my kids to bring sandwiches with sides of fruits or veggies and dips. On the first try, the dip leaked all over their lunchboxes, despite carefully sealing the lids. It's too late to return them now because I tried to make them work. They are sturdy and nice-looking containers. Just not all I'd hoped they would be. Perhaps they'll work for something else, but unless I find a good use for them, I'm highly disappointed in what I got for the money these cost.
customer_reviews.author: Fade's Mama

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Got these so that I wouldn't have to use multiple plastic containers for packing my daughter's lunch every day. I refuse to send multiple ziplock bags to a landfill every day, plus they don't keep things like chips and grapes from getting squashed inside her lunch bag. These containers perfect for that need. So much easier and convenient, plus they take up less room than separate containers do. And, smaller containers sometimes don't make it home, but these don't get lost or left behind.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: New version is not durable
customer_reviews.text: These are so disappointing - my old ones were very durable and lasted a school year. The last set I bought has lasted 2 months and nearly all are cracked and destroyed. I will be looking for a better alternative as this product is no longer worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: ❤️ ATX

customer_reviews.title: Last a long time!
customer_reviews.text: Really well made boxes. I bought these 3 years ago for my son to take for lunch while he was in kindergarten he is now in the 2nd grade and only 2 of them have a side chipped. I am going to buy more for when my other sons start school in the fall. I do wash them in the top rack of the dishwasher. I have no issues with the lids not sealing. These are the heavy plastic ones -not thin like the ones ziplock sells.
customer_reviews.author: mudslides

customer_reviews.title: his PE shirt in his bag smells like salsa. I guess it has to stay flat ...
customer_reviews.text: Meh, I was so excited that these wouldn't leak, but they totally do. To be safe I had put in a gallon Ziploc for my son's backpack and the ziploc was dripping wet, his PE shirt in his bag smells like salsa. I guess it has to stay flat on the ground and not move to be leak-proof. These are only good for dry items like sandwiches and grapes and crackers. Oh well.....
customer_reviews.author: Kabad

customer_reviews.title: Tab broke after second use.
customer_reviews.text: Packed my child a lunch yesterday. Hand washed the lunch box last night and used it again the today. When she came home today the tab of the lid had broken and left a jagged edge. Not worth the money for a product that breaks after two uses and one wash. And apparently it's not returnable, as I tried and found out it's not eligible for return, even though I received them only one week ago. Won't buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: I. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Good for school lunches.
customer_reviews.text: Started using these to pack lunch for my 3.5 year old in preschool. The portion sizes are good and there is room for more food when his appetite increases. We’ve been using these for over 2 months now. The kids are a bit stiff but he hasn’t complained about not being to open it. They clean easily. They fit well in his lunchbox. We haven’t put them in the dishwasher and haven’t microwaved in them.
customer_reviews.author: SarahSchlosser

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lunch boxes
customer_reviews.text: I love these boxes! My son and daughter both get one a day, and they hold a lot! Usually lunch and snack can fit in these boxes, and all grandma has to do it take the lid off. They like the presentation, and I like how they nest for easy storage. Colors are cute on the lids too.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job - wishing for a few size changes
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these lunchboxes off and on for about a year with my 3 and 5 year olds for school lunch. Paired with the silicone muffin cups to separate food, they are very easy to use and very attractive to my kids. They fit easily into an LL Bean lunchbox with a slim fit ice pack. (No room for a drink though.) However, being pretty busy and realistic, convenience foods do often make their way into their lunches, and we cannot fit the following into these containers due to height issues: yogurt cups (yogurt stick work, when bent) fruit cups/applesauce pudding cups another quarter-inch in height for the containers and it would work! Alas.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndyth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Kindergartener's Healthy Lunch
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I use them for my kindergartener's lunch. They are sturdy and well made, and fit in his lunchbox perfectly. I really love the 3 compartments I can use for a variety of foods. Before purchasing, I read reviews that these are not leakproof and I'm okay with that b/c I'm not using it for anything that would leak, like possibly applesauce. I stick to drier foods like sandwiches, half banana, cut up veggies, nuts, sealed yogurt tube, cut up fruit like apples or oranges, etc. These containers fit our needs perfectly and the bright colors make it fun! I would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: better than store bought!
customer_reviews.text: First, I do sort of wish the lids would snap on tighter BUT it does say in the description that these are not liquid safe. That being said, I do like these lunchbox dishes. I was fairly worried that they would be the cheap plastic like the ones in stores but this plastic is thick and sturdy. And whereas the lids aren't as perfectly sealed as some others, they do snap on well. Also, they came with a little sample pack of lunchbox notes from sayplease.com and they are adorable! I would definitely purchase again. They're perfect for my daughter's lunches but I may even use them for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Nattie Berry

customer_reviews.title: We love these lunch containers
customer_reviews.text: We love these lunch containers! I use them daily for my 3-year-old's lunch at school; they are durable and the lids are easy for her to open. She has the Wildkin Double Decker Lunch Bag which fits one of these containers perfectly in the bottom part. We also use these (along with the insulated EasyLunchBoxes cooler bag) for the whole family when we go on day trips and they certainly fit enough food for adults. I wash them by hand only because we don't have a dishwasher, but according to the product information you can put them in a dishwasher. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G

customer_reviews.title: These work but I am not shouting from the roof top!
customer_reviews.text: These work for dry foods. I put pickles in and it ruined the lunch, the juice leaked into the other containers so the cookies were mushy and the sandwich tasted like pickle juice. So I only use these for dry foods and they work great for that!
customer_reviews.author: JMO

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these!!!
customer_reviews.text: These bento boxes are so great! I use them for my 3 year old and 16 month old. They are much more affordable than many other bento options. They wash well in the dishwasher and I've had zero leaks. I recommend using silicon baking cups to create more compartments and keep food separated. I use them for my kids' preschool lunches, zoo outings, and trips to grandparents' houses so they don't have to worry with creating/cutting up food for my kids. All they have to do is take off the lid and they're ready to go :)
customer_reviews.author: Brichmond

customer_reviews.title: I think it’s still better compared to the Amazon Basics one which we also ...
customer_reviews.text: They’re okay. It holds enough portions of meals for my kids’ lunches. It fits their lunch boxes perfectly. My only concern is that it doesn’t take long for the plastic lid to disintegrate (chip off) and even the containter themselves. I think it’s still better compared to the Amazon Basics one which we also have and didn’t last a week in our house. This one is still good while it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone down.
customer_reviews.text: The quality on these have drastically declined. I purchased my first couple of sets 4 and 6 years ago and they lasted quite a while before the plastic lip on the lid (to open the containers) started breaking. These didn’t even last a couple months. Very frustrating. Younger kids have a very hard time opening them without that lip.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin West

customer_reviews.title: What I expected/ Tabs break off
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I expected and they work perfectly. I took off one star because the tab broke off of one when it fell 2 feet and hit the floor. That was the second day I used it, so I was very disappointed. I was surprised it snapped so easily. I fully expect the other tabs to break off at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Brittni

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lunch containers
customer_reviews.text: These have been a great purchase for my kids lunches. I like that there’s just 3 compartments and they are super easy to clean by hand or in the dishwasher. I don’t think they are designed to be leak proof so I don’t put yogurt in it or anything like that, but I’ve never had juice from fruit end up in another compartment. I recently reached out to the company to see if I could purchase more lids because they keep disappearing at my house. They responded very promptly and are sending me some at no charge!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great product and a GREAT price!
customer_reviews.text: These are a life-saver. After Zip-Loc discontinued their version of these, I'd researched other lunchbox solutions. They were all either too expensive or contained multiple pieces and I was really looking for a 1-piece with multiple compartments. I don't seem to have the problem with more liquidy things seeping from one compartment into the other as other reviewers have had. I mean, I wouldn't put soup into a compartment or anything, but I do put things like cottage cheese, apple sauce, and ketchup without a problem. You do need to be deliberate about putting the lid on so that every "corner" and compartment is correctly closed, but that's really the only drawback (if you even consider that one!).
customer_reviews.author: Simona Masini

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase they arrive broken! Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: These were going to be great but we got our order and one of the tops is totally cracked and they little tab to help you open the container is broken. You can’t return these I wouldn’t buy them again. I am seriously so mad I wasted my money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Emley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Lunches
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for lunches. The large compartment fits a sandwich nicely. None of the foods I've packed have spilled over into other compartments. But, I wouldn't say that these are leak-proof. (You couldn't put soup in one compartment, carry the container on its side, and think that the soup wouldn't leak into other compartments or out of the container. I have put soup in it, carried it UPRIGHT the whole time, and my soup didn't leak.) I've washed these in the dishwasher and used them in the microwave, with no warping or discolorations. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lunch container.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my 7 year old. They fit perfectly in his lunch bag with a small juice box. So much easier and cheaper to put his sandwich, crackers, fruit and veggies all in the same container instead of a ziploc bag. Which sometimes can be hard to open for him if I buy the ones without the zipper. Less mess also! Over all very satisfied with my purchase. Also I have had no problems with the corner tabs breaking and run the container and lid through the dishwasher all the time and they have not damaged.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Great for Adults!!!
customer_reviews.text: I take care of my two elderly parents and my elderly mother-in-law. I bought 24 of these so I could put prepared dinners in their refrigerators. Because they stack nicely and efficiently, they take up little space. Because the lids are colored, I just leave an index card on their countertop(s) saying what food is in the container with the corresponding colored lid. Speaking of the lids -- they do not snap so tightly that it causes them (elderly people) problems trying to get them open, so, from that standpoint they love them too. That being said, if you're sending these to school with kids who 'rough-house', I could envision the containers opening up and spilling.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Preschuti

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after 1 month.
customer_reviews.text: We have had these for little over 1 month. In that time frame 3 out of the 4 are all broken and falling apart. I have followed all washing and drying directions and our son has a padded lunchbox so it is not getting smashed at school. The corners are all broken and small plastic pieces are falling off. There are cracks in the bottom of the container as well. For the cost of these - I expected way more longevity. I could expect this wear from a few months or so - but he has used them for 1 month! The dollar store containers have held up better then these. Super disappointed:(
customer_reviews.author: melissa j. pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Small leaks
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have known they specifically state that they are NOT LEAK-PROOF. The first couple times I used them with just the tiniest bit of liquid (i.e. drained canned peaches) it spilled into the lunch box (because I have to carry it sideways). Now I just make sure my food isn't watery and put a paper towel to catch drips. Other than that they have held out through multiple dishwasher cycles and don't show any signs of wear. They seem like solid quality, and it's been very useful for sending school lunches.
customer_reviews.author: Sarahb2004

customer_reviews.title: babysitter requested these
customer_reviews.text: Our babysitter requested them as it makes it easier for food to be served and fits well on her tray tables. Our only issue is that we had to buy a bigger lunch box to accommodate them but good product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Lunch box
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect to control portions. Plus I was looking for a compartment type lunch box I could easily fit in my cooler bag. Easy to wipe out as well if you don't have a sink to wash it out immediately after eating. Highly recommend it. Plus its deep enough to fit left overs in. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: So nice to have in my preschoolers lunch box! You have to make sure to really snap it down in all the corners or it will leak but besides that it fits well in my girl’s lunch box and it’s nice to pack her lunch in.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: one of the tops broke before I even used it!
customer_reviews.text: Yet it's too much of a PIA to return such an inexpensive product. I give it two stars because my son loves having his very own left-over container in our refrigerator. He gets excited every time he opens one of them to find his dinner or lunch. Edited to add: Been using these since purchase and they are pretty good. I only use them with dry food b/c the sections are not sealed off from each other. However, they are great and aside from the one that broke originally, they work great and have aged well. Furthermore, they fit in the LLBean flip top lunch-box perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Nola Caine

customer_reviews.title: Really like them but one has already cracked - -Updated Review 1/3/17
customer_reviews.text: I really like these lunch box containers but after two uses (by my 13 year old daughter) one of the corners has cracked off :-(. Disappointed because I really wanted more! 1/3/2017 Followup Review. I contacted EasyLunchBoxes and after sending proof of purchase I was sent a replacement. I received the replacement in 2 days!! Great Company that stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: the4olsons

customer_reviews.title: Love these for school lunches; Great space saver as they stack!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I bought two sets for my son to use at daycare/school and love how I can pack his fruit, veggies, and sandwiches or treats. I use along with silicone cupcake liners (like this:  so i can create additional smaller spaces to add things like cookies, raisins, nuts, etc. I also love how colorful they are. :) These lunchboxes and lids are also stackable which is a great space saver! :)
customer_reviews.author: Morocco Dreamin

customer_reviews.title: Slightly big, but it gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for both of my kids lunches. I wanted one place to place all their food with its own separate divider. However, the container is a little bigger than I would have liked. In the larger compartment I have packed a whole sandwich, wraps, & pita sandwiches w/out a problem. The smaller containers I usually pack different fruit and or veggies. I’ve never had an issue with leaking & I've packed tuna many times.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Good, just not for kids
customer_reviews.text: These don't hold up to a 6yo and his antics. 2 have broken so far due to being tossed around in a padded lunch bag. Nice containers as a whole, are great for a small salad or a sandwich and snacks. Would be fine for an adult or someone who won't play fetch with them.
customer_reviews.author: A. Waterfield

customer_reviews.title: Used to be better
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a set of these 4 years ago and they held up really well. I decided to get another set in August since I have two kids packing lunches now. On the new set, all of the sides have promptly cracked. They're still usable, but obviously harder to open and kind of sharp. Not impressed with the quality anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Spj

customer_reviews.title: Great for school lunches
customer_reviews.text: These work great for my kids lunches! My only minor complaint is with some foods like strawberries or watermelon, the fruit juices will get into the other compartments if my kids are carrying them around sideways in their lunch bag. I had to buy the smaller sauce like containers with lids for an extra level of 'security' for those kinds of foods. I've had these for two school years. They now have competitors that are cheaper which I haven't tried yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged but not returnable!
customer_reviews.text: When I received these containers, 2 of them were chipped already. My kids could cut their fingers so I wanted to return them but Amazon didn’t let me because they are not returnable. Who wants to use this broken cheap plastic bento box for kids! I want my money back!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in August of 2018 and was able to use them daily for my 3 children for the whole year. Bought another set August of this year and every single one cracked and is no useable after less than 4 months. Something changed for sure
customer_reviews.author: Mommyoftwincesses

customer_reviews.title: Pleased wife and mom. ;)
customer_reviews.text: These containers are awesome. I understand they are not the $40 stainless steel bento containers, but for what these are, they are great. I purchased them to cut down on baggies for my husband's lunches and I'm even more pleased than that. They are lunches for my kids to take to grandma's too. The large section is perfect for a sandwich, or a wrap with some vegetables off on the side. I mix in some silicone cupcake liners for some peanut butter or hummus or other dipping item, and it works perfectly. I have always put them on the top shelf of the dishwasher and have not had any warping or other kinds of issues.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: These have worked great so far for us
customer_reviews.text: These have worked great so far for us. We have used them almost daily since school started in mid August (at time of review it is November 3) with no issues. After reading previous reviews, I do not snap the lids on tightly to try to make them last longer. Nothing as leaked, we used a lunchbox another reviewer suggested so its not tilted to the side. I only wash these in the dishwasher and they have held up great, no cracks so far. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Came cracked- box not damaged. Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: Product was cracked when it arrived. I can’t figure out how to just call the company to try and get some compensation. To make matters worse, I bought the smaller sized (4-compartment snack size) containers for my Kindergartener, and the first time he used it, the tab cracked on his favorite color top!! Ugh. I do not recommend this product. I tried 2 different types and the BOTH BROKE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple, inexpensive works great
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a long time and after deciding there’s no way I’m getting a $70 lunchbox for a preschooler I got these. The big compartment is big enough for a sandwich and they’re not expensive so who cares if they get lost! The matching lunchbox has been great too. With multiple ones if you don’t remember to wash it every night you have another clean one ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: hln9000

customer_reviews.title: Still Love them!
customer_reviews.text: This was my second order of easy lunch box containers. My first set is about 3-4 years old and still in great shape-- no discoloration or cracking. We'd lost a couple of lids so we needed more. This set is even better! The kids snap on more securely but are still easy for little hands to open. I've got 5 kids so the colored lids are super helpful for packing lunches. I have the bright set and the primary set and the colors are great! We have Lands End soft lunch boxes and these fit in them perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: TaylorCR

customer_reviews.title: Great Lunchbox!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for my kids for three years and we just reordered more! They love them and I do too! They DO advertise that they aren't leakproof, but we have not had any issues when putting thicker liquids in them (yogurt, applesauce, dipping sauces, pizza sauce) - wouldn't recommend doing soup tho. But def worth purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brock

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited about these however, I have had them one day and 2 are broken. The first broke while I was washing it. The 2nd broke in my son's lunch box. The plastic is cheap and breaks easily.
customer_reviews.author: Joelle

customer_reviews.title: My excitement soon turned to disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I found this product, as it seemed to be just what I was looking for. When they arrived, they seemed to be good quality, durable containers. However, with the first use, my son came home with a cracked and broken lid. With the second use, another cracked lid. He’s not a careless sort of child, so I was surprised and VERY DISAPPOINTED. I thought these would be a good way to reduce lunchbox waste; instead they turned out to be a big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: I would like for it to be tighter and really seal
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. I would prefer for it to have a loud snap so you know its closed. I would like for it to be tighter and really seal. Because with very little effort the lid comes off. So if you are the type of person who is in a rush and throws their bag down of puts a lot in their lunch bag DO NOT put anything on the side that could pry the lid up. I bought the ljnchbag that goes with this so I can't put anything on the side anyway. Great for children not so much for busy adults.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: They are roomy and the lids are easy to remove but secure enough to be in a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughters lunches. They are roomy and the lids are easy to remove but secure enough to be in a lunchbox. They are NOT leakproof but I knew that when I bought it. The company makes a lunchox to go with these containers that keeps them upright and flat which is great because in most lunchboxes they would be sideways when carried. I wish they were sold as singles though because at most I've only used at most 2 at a time but I guess if you want to prepack the weeks lunches or even to have one out while one is dirty 4 would be useful
customer_reviews.author: E. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to find a compartmented container that was just the right size for packing lunch...until I get to work and find my lunch is already dripping from my lunch bag (also an EasyLunchBoxes product) all over the seat in my car. (I had packed steamed squash). I've had better luck with a cheap bowl from the dollar store than this container! Now back to searching for something that actually works... :(
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Bento Feel Without the Bento Price!
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually excited about bringing my lunch because of these lunch boxes! The plastic is a bit thicker than other containers you see at the store, and therefore, I think they'll hold up much better. The lids snap shut, and the colors are fun! I appreciate the divided compartments, giving it that bento feel without the bento price. Let's see if these will help keep me on the straight and narrow so I'll stop buying lunch!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Molly

product_meta.title: EasyLunchboxes Lunch Box Food Containers, 3-Compartment, Set of 4, Classic
feature_bullets: THE ORIGINALS: EasyLunchboxes are often imitated, never duplicated. The original stackable, portable, reusable, and affordable way to prep healthy lunches and snacks for school, work, or on the go
BUILT-IN PORTION CONTROL: 3 perfectly portioned compartments make it easy to pack a balanced meal for any size appetite from kids to adults
EASY-OPEN LIDS: Designed with kid-friendly lids that stay securely on, but can be easily removed by toddlers (not leak-proof)
MICROWAVE, FREEZER, & DISHWASHER SAFE: BPA-free containers designed by a mom to be easy to clean, convenient to use, and quick to organize
WHAT YOU GET: Set of 4 EasyLunchboxes 3-Compartment Lunch Containers and caring customer support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,863 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
